CatDescriptText: Mr. Evan Tooks, retired employee, C.G. Hussey Company, 715 Cherokee St., was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 12, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the President of the United States should intervene in the steel strike, or should he wait, and then invoke the 80-day 'cooling off' period as prescribed in the Taft-Hartley Act?" answer reads: "I don't think the President should have anything to do with it. The strike should be settled between the union and management."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Evan Tooks wearing eyeglasses, light colored button down collared shirt with rolled up sleeves and breast pockets, standing in front of William's BAR B Q
